    • Fitting occupancy models with flocker

Fit an occupancy model

Source: R/flock.R
flock.Rd

Fit an occupancy model

flock(f_occ, f_det, flocker_data, data2 = NULL, rep_constant = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

f_occ

A brms-type model formula for occupancy. Must begin with "~".
f_det

A brms-type model formula for detection. Must begin with "~".
flocker_data

data, generally the output of make_flocker_data().
data2

additional data (e.g. a covariance matrix for a phylogenetic effect)
rep_constant

A logical indicator. Are detection probabilities constant across repeated sampling events within closure units?
...

additional arguments passed to brms::brm()

Value

a brmsfit containing the fitted occupancy model.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
example_data <- example_flocker_data()
fd <- make_flocker_data(example_data$obs, example_data$unit_covs, example_data$event_covs)
flock(f_occ = ~ uc1 + s(uc2) + (1|grp),
          f_det = ~ uc1 + ec1 + s(ec2) + (1|grp),
          flocker_data = fd,
          refresh = 50, chains = 1, warmup = 5, iter = 200,
          adapt_engaged = F, step_size = .05, max_treedepth = 5, seed = 123)
}
